alert.note: Alert for Broward; Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 12 at 2:33PM EDT until April 12 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHERN BROWARD AND NORTHERN MIAMI-DADE COUNTIES... At 233 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen during the last couple of hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area with the ongoing thunderstorms. Several street flooding is being reported over this area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Miami, Hialeah, Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Miramar, Miami Beach, Surfside, Miami Gardens, Hallandale, North Miami, North Miami Beach, Aventura, Sunny Isles Beach, Opa-Locka, West Park, Miami Shores, North Bay Village, El Portal, Golden Glades and Ojus. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
